disease: Enterocolitis due to Clostridium difficile, recurrent

symptoms.name: Severe diarrhea
symptoms.pattern: Recurrent, within 2-8 weeks of initial infection

symptoms.name: Abdominal pain
symptoms.pattern: Can be severe in some cases

vital_signs.heart_rate: May be elevated due to dehydration or infection severity
vital_signs.blood_pressure: May be low due to dehydration
vital_signs.temperature: May be elevated due to infection

physical_findings: Signs of dehydration (dry mucous membranes, decreased skin turgor)

lab_values.white_blood_cell_count: May be elevated in severe cases
lab_values.serum_creatinine: May be elevated in severe cases

risk_factors: Lack of adaptive immune response to toxins A and B

imaging_findings.CT_scan: May show signs of colitis or complications

required: Unexplained diarrhea (3 or more unformed stools per day)
supportive: Symptoms consistent with C. difficile infection

differential_diagnoses: Other causes of diarrhea (viral gastroenteritis, bacterial gastroenteritis, inflammatory bowel disease)
